programme.title: Defenders of the Wild
programme.desc: Since some African countries allow for private ownership of wildlife, this generated an industry of trade that hoped to rejuvenate the fauna of the land; the team uses unique high-stakes methods to capture various species.

programme.title: Defenders of the Wild
programme.desc: Hands-on participation in an ambitious project to translocate 100 elephants to repopulate some of Africa's depleted national parks.

programme.title: Defenders of the Wild
programme.desc: Dr. Dave Gaynor conducts a natural experiment and introduces lions and cheetahs into the Zambezi Delta to look at the role apex predators play, prey and adapt in the ecosystem.

programme.title: Defenders of the Wild
programme.desc: Hunter's dollars fund sheep conservation across the U.S. and the story is told through a hands-on translocation reestablishing historic home range for bighorn sheep.

programme.title: Defenders of the Wild
programme.desc: Anti-poaching laws, community meat drops and upliftment initiatives are returning wildlife to the Zambezi Delta.

programme.title: Defenders of the Wild
programme.desc: Understanding the history of bison populations in the U.S., and the current state of their protection, getting involved in collaring efforts in the Henry Mountains.

programme.title: Defenders of the Wild
programme.desc: Giraffe Conservation Foundation is taking action across the continent to save the giraffe.

programme.title: Defenders of the Wild
programme.sub-title: Quail: The Health of the Land
programme.desc: Quail populations in Texas are a crucial indicator species that are the canary in the coal mine for ecosystem health.

programme.title: Defenders of the Wild
programme.desc: The rescue and rehabilitation of orphaned chimpanzees from the bushmeat and pet trade in the Democratic Republic of the Congo.

programme.title: Defenders of the Wild
programme.desc: Rhinos are threatened due to demand for their horns in Asia, so Ivan heads to the frontlines, where poaching events are a weekly occurrence, and explains conservation measures used to protect them.

programme.title: Defenders of the Wild
programme.desc: Human-wildlife conflict is prevalent across Africa, so to mitigate conflicts, Ivan joins Roger Whittall to collar bull elephants to create an early warning system for surrounding communities.

programme.title: Defenders of the Wild
programme.desc: Research has informed biologists about how to protect bear species, but gathering the data requires collaring them; biologists must crawl into their dens during hibernation and dart them, then apply collars.

programme.desc: Since some African countries allow for private ownership of wildlife, this generated an industry of trade that hoped to rejuvenate the fauna of the land; the team uses unique high-stakes methods to capture various species.

programme.title: Car Crews With Supercar Blondie
programme.desc: Supercar Blondie goes to Hollywood arriving in a million-dollar V12 Ferrari; in the City of Angels, Alex is brought into contact with the Brotherhood of Racing, a community of drivers looking to create safe racing conditions for amateurs.

programme.title: Car Crews With Supercar Blondie
programme.desc: Given special access to a $2 million exclusive McClaren Senna, Supercar Blondie digs under the surface to uncover gang feuds in the SLAB (Slow, Low and Bangin') community and meets up with legendary hip hop artists Slim Thug and Paul Wall.

programme.title: Car Crews With Supercar Blondie
programme.desc: Supercar Blondie arrives in Las Vegas in a $1 million Lamborghini SVJ roadster; taken under the wing of Patrick, founder of the Junkyard Pirates, Alex is brought into the rat rod world, home to American mavericks and outsiders.

programme.title: Car Crews With Supercar Blondie
programme.desc: In Miami, Supercar Blondie gets the keys to a $5 million Pagani Huayra L'Ultimo as she explores the sub-culture of lowriders with the seal of approval from Horacio Pagani himself.

programme.title: Car Crews With Supercar Blondie
programme.desc: Supercar Blondie arrives in Motor City in the dead of winter, but she is given access to a new $500 thousand Ford GT, which raises her spirits; her goal is to learn more about muscle cars and her journey takes her in different directions.

programme.title: Car Crews With Supercar Blondie
programme.desc: Supercar Blondie hits New York City in a $4 million Lamborghini Centenario; she is on a quest to track down the players in the underground drift driving scene and to visit the exclusive Manhattan Motor Club.
